DOC.criteria: 18 year old Headache must meet IHS criterion migraine probable migraine 2 4 following : Unilateral location Throbbing ( pulsate ) quality Moderate severe intensity ( inhibits/prohibits daily activity ) Exacerbation moderate activity mild activity During HA , least 1 3 following : Nausea and/or vomit Photophobia Phonophobia Known allergy study medication Pregnancy < 18 year old Inability provide write , informed consent Patients positive lumbar puncture positive CT scan suspect secondary headache History peptic ulcer disease History liver failure History coagulopathy Gastrointestinal bleeding within last 3 month Previous gastrointestinal bleeding nonsteroidal antiinflammatory medication Ingestion pain medication within previous six hour deem put patient risk exceed toxic dose ASA acetaminophen ( > 100mg/kg ASA acetaminophen ) Vomiting within one hour receive oral study medication .
